description: Proposed modification to construction working hours to Planning Permission 19/00582/FUL (which currently permits Saturday working between 8am and 1pm). The proposal is to extend working hours on a Saturday to 8am to 4.30pm.  (The construction working hours would Commence on 3rd October 2020 and Cease on 1st April 2021)
decision_conditions: The proposed modification to Planning Condition 5 of planning permission 19/00582/FUL to enable working hours on a Saturday from 0800hrs to 1630hrs would be reasonable and proportionate and would not result in a significant impact on health in accordance with policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.

--- Officer Report ---IntroductionThis application is of a nature where the Council's Constitution delegates the authority to make the decision to Officers rather than it being decided by a Committee of Councillors.  Before preparing this summary report a Planning Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the relevant Development Plan policies and guidance, considered any relevant previous planning applications, and considered any comments made by those interested in the application such as consultees with specialist knowledge and nearby residents. By indicating that the development proposal complies with relevant Development Plan policies, the planning officer is taking into account the information submitted with the application, any previous relevant applications, any comments received in connection with the application and any other case specific considerations which are material to the decision.The Development Plan comprises:The London Plan 2021;RBK Core Strategy 2012;Kingston Town Centre Area Action Plan 2008; and,The South London Waste Plan 2012.This decision has been authorised by a Senior Officer (Authorising Officer) in the Development Management Service. Prior to endorsing the Planning Officer's recommendation, the Authorising Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the application documents, the relevant planning policies and guidance, any relevant history, and any representations received.Application SiteThe site comprises a residential dwelling.AssessmentThe key areas of assessment are:- The design of the proposed development; and,- The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings.DesignWhen read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS) (2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer Comment: It is considered that the proposed rear extensions would not be a subordinate addition or be architecturally sympathetic to the host property. The depth of the ground floor rear extension with its expanse of flat roof is considered to be excessive and the the flat roofed first floor extension would not sit conmfortably with the host property and 'jar' with the existing host properties character and appearance. The extensions would in particular the first floor extension be visually intrusive in the  views of the site from the surrounding properties. The rear extensions would detract from the character and appearance of the host property and the surrounding area and would not accord with policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012. Neighbouring AmenitiesPolicy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officer Comment:  It is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy.ConclusionIn conclusion, the proposed development is considered not to be in accordance with the development plan and there are no other material considerations which warrant a decision other than not in accordance with the development plan.Details of the Application SubmissionIn accordance with the requirements of Local Government Act 1972 details of the application submission were available on the Council's website during the assessment of the application.https://www.kingston.gov.uk/info/200155/planning_applications_and_permissions/263/find_a_planning_application_or_appeal--- Informatives ---Positive and ProactiveIn dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.PlansThe applicant should note that the plans are incomplete and the front elevation is missing with the submission. In addition the floor plans do not quite match up with the elevations for example a door is shown on the side of the floor plan but is omitted in the elevation. Such anomalies on the plans and omissions of plans would need to be addressed in any future submission and could have a further bearing on the LPA's assessment of the suitability of the proposed or future proposed development.

Please provide Proposed Floor Plans at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing the outline of the entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works. The plans must also show the direction of North. Although the inclusion of a scale bar is not mandatory, it is encouraged. If you show the approved extension, then please annotate with the planning reference.
